p: Besides, the use of Prunus spp. and Linum usitatissimum L. as anti-hyperthyroid remedy could be due to the presence of cyanogenic glycosides compounds i.e. amygdalin, dhurrin, and linamarin. These compounds are known to generate thiocyanate and thiocyanate-like which are monovalent anions with a molecular size similar to that of iodide and therefore, they compete with iodide at the thyroid peroxidase level which inhibit its assimilation into thyroglobulin ( Chandra, 2010).
